_localizedContents._text: You are on “death row" for a horrible crime that you have not committed. You know that you were framed, but despite your best efforts you weren’t able to prove it. In your small mountain town it is forbidden to kill someone directly… you won’t be shot, decapitated or hanged, and instead you will left alone outside of the walls: you'll wander around, aimlessly, until your will dies and your body abandons you.
There is, however, a chance.

A secret vein of gold is said to be hidden inside the mountain. If you are able to find it, rumors say that you will be granted a pardon. On each of the 3 days before your punishment, you will be visited by a different “bearer”, someone that is supposed to provide closure and help you cope with your situation. Listen to them, insult them, or just ignore them. It doesn't matter. Just do as you please. You are gonna die anyway, right?

The first day has arrived, and with it came a tall and lanky figure. It's completely black, and it's face is blank: no eyes, no mouth, nothing. It's body strolls casually, phasing through everything in it's path. It looks at you, dead in the eyes, and starts speaking
How did you end up like this?
I was framed
Why should I tell you? It's not gonna help me in any way

Don't search for the gold, don't dig, just wait for your moment to go. Observe nature, bathe in the sun, think about your good memories. That's all you can do... What is the point of suffering, if it brings you nothing in return? And even if it could, why bother? You are still a criminal, nobody will want you if you manage to get out of here. Life doesn't matter, you don't matter, so don't stress yourself. Just enjoy what you've got for now
I don't have much time left, I must go, I hope to have brought you some closure, or at least something to think about. The truth might hurt, but it's better to know it than to ignore it
So? What's your point?
You are just spewing nonsense
Oh really, and can you tell me what "making sense" would imply instead?

My point is that there is no point. All choices, in the end, will lead to the same outcome. Someone will die, someone will suffer, but in the end everybody will be met with death, and in that moment every choice, every tear, every waking moment will become meaningless
So should I give up? Should I end my life?
You are just spewing nonsense
Yes, It's my only chance of living
No, I can't be bothered
No, that's not what I'm saying... I'll make it clear with one more question: Do you want to search for the gold?
And why do you want to live so badly?
Because I just do
Because I've not yet fullfilled my purpouse
Because I have yet to find my role in this world

See? Those are just your instincts talking for you. I can't say that I don't understand, but what's the point of even struggling if you don't have a goal or something to achieve? And even if you had one, it would not matter in the end. Listen to what I have to say...
What purpouse? There is no purpouse! The entire world exist just because it does! We are born just to live and then to die. Stop trying to fullfill a prophecy that doesn't exist

Then you can still stop before you find the illusion of a purpouse. Why struggle for something that is pointless? There is no higher meaning, no role, there is just nature, the world, the universe. An then there is death, the inevitable, eternal void. You are a human, you eat, sleep, drink, procreate and then die. Nothing else matters, so...
Good, I see that you're beginning to understand
Eheh... I see that you get it. You've already given up, right?
Yes
Whatever, just leave me alone

Then, I might not be needed after all. It's nice to find somebody that agrees with me. Most people, usually, struggle at least just a bit before realising the truth. I'll be going, then. We don't have a lot of time, so I might as well do the most with what I have... And so shall you. Relax, buddy, nothing matters anyways
And just like that, he vanished. However, you feel different now. Like something inside you is starting to break
Damn, you're doing far worse than I imagined. Ahahahahah, are you just scared of death?
$hasSeed = true
A seed of doubt has been planted
I just don't want to talk with you
Then you will never understand
Sure, have it your way
And just like that, he vanished.
You have to realise that there is only one truth, one constant in this world:
Everything is meaningless, and death is inevitable
So why the long face?
So I should be happy that there is no purpouse?
Just fuck off
No, happy is not the right term... I mean, if you could, go for it. But even being indifferent towards it is ok. Just don't stress yourself too much, that's what I'm getting at.
The earlier you realise it, the easier it will be for you to go.
My time has run out. Remember my words. Goodbye
And that's not fair, right?
Yes, of course it isn't
What are you getting at?
Just... what does "fair" even mean?
Do I really need to tell you? It's just common sense
And where does that "common sense" come from?
I feel it, instinctively
It's what I believe to be rigth
There's only one instinct: the will to live. Everything else is just a fabrication of your own mind. Something that you create to avoid the truth and feel better about yourself
Your moral code?
Yes

And what are morals, if not fantasies? Reality is different. Morals are useless in our world. If morals were so important, why is there so much suffering, why are innocent people butchered everywhere?
And what is the truth?
So what about emotions?
You just build castles to avoid facing reality, to shield yourself from the truth that will hurt you:
There are no morals, no gods, and there is no purpouse to this life and to our universe. The sooner you realise it, the faster you'll be able to deal with it
I don't quite understand it, and it's hard to put it into words. But there is something undescribable, something primal and subconscious that tells me that you're... just a fool
I just... feel this way. And you can try to convince me all you want, but you'll never do it
You feel something burning deep inside you. Something that you had forgotten has finally awakened again
%hasSpark = true
Fine, there's no point in arguing with you. Goodbye
And just like that, the figure vanishes

Emotions reflect your will to live. They are tricks that your brain creates to reward those behavior that ensure your survival... Think about it: If you eat, you're happy. It's not because the act of eating has any value, but because your are providing your body with nutrients, which lets you live. If you fall in love, you might think that you're happy because of some romantic ideal, but it's just because you're obeying your primate brain, which is telling you to reproduce.
Nobody is there to punish evildoers, and good people don't always get rewarded... Just take a look at yourself
A seed of doubt has been planted
$hasSeed = true
And just like that, the figure vanished. However, you feel different now. Like something inside you is starting to break
A seed of doubt has been planted
$hasSeed = true
And just like that, the figure vanished. However, you feel different now. Like something inside you is starting to break
The second day hass arrived, but nobody came to visit you.
It's now night-time, and you're preparing to go to sleep. Suddenly, you hear someone knock on your door
Who's there?
*Open the door*
*Ignore it*
I'm the lantern bearer and I've come to talk with you
After a few minutes, the knocking begins again
Who's there?
*Open the door*
*Ignore it again*
After a while, the knocking stops. Then, you see the ligth moving away from your door. You can finally go to sleep
*Open the door*
I don't want to talk with you

A mysterious man holding a lantern enters the room. He is completely covered by a white cape, making any of his features indistinguishable. He sits in front of you, and despite putting the lantern on the table you still aren't able to look him in the eyes. It's as if his face is itself a font of pure, bright light
Why is that, prisoner?
What does it matter if I do? I'm still gonna die
I have a lot to think about right now
Fine, then I'll leave. Good night.
This mentality is why you need to talk to me...
Fine. Come in
I don't care, go away
You've made the right choice
Hello, prisoner, let's have a few words, shall we?
$hasSeed
After a little while, you decide to open the door
I know what the other bearer told you, So I want to ask you this: are you afraid? And if you are, what are you afraid of?
Well... That is interesting
I'm not afraid
I am afraid
I fear death
I fear having lost all my certainties
$hasSpark
I can sense it... Your spark, the fire inside you will start to burn soon
You're like an animal, trying to survive at all costs. But is that really all there is to it?
What do you mean?
I'd like to know why you want to survive this badly, is it only because of your instincts?
Yes
No
That's amusing, you truly are different from everybody else. Maybe you'll be able to do it.

You still feel it, right? Your past experiences, your memories, your life before this point... Everything adding up, culminating in what you are right now. This is what makes you human. What built your character. But you are still incomplete, you need something more
What do I need?
And how can I achieve it?
I can't really tell you, the answer is yours to find
And how can I achieve it?
You need to face your fears
You shouldn't be afraid of it. In fact, you should be glad
I can understand. It's foolish to fear death, but it's still something that humans do. It's in your nature. But that... That is why you must surpass it
Humanity has always overcome it's limits.
Why?
How can I be glad? I feel so empty
Because now you're free to find some new ones

Most people don't care about finding their road... They are held back by their old beliefs, and as such they keep walking the same path. Refusing to change, to grow, to face their fears and, most importantly, reality
And what can I obtain from facing my fears?
Or maybe you'll succumb before you do... Instinct alone may be enough to survive... But is it enough to live?

You should be glad because only by tearing ourselves down can we build ourselves back up stronger than before. That's how everyting in this world works if you think about it. When a forest burns down, the ashes work as fertilisers to make more trees grows. These trees will be stronger, taller and more beatiful
U
These metaphores don't make me feel less hollow
What does it matter anyway? I'm still gonna die, and then it will al be pointless
The more that you stand in the darkness, the more you'll start to see right through it.
Only then, you will find what truly makes light and what doesn't
But this light... It's not made by others, or given to you by an higher power
It's yours, and yours only. Other people may rely on it, and you might rely on theirs, but doing so will only lead to some situations in which the darkness becomes just too thick
Discard what's useless, keep what's effective, and you'll finally be able to walk freely
Are you beginning to understand?
Yes, and I get your point
Yes, but you make no sense
No, it's all too complicated
You'll realise it when you're ready
Good... Then what will you do?
I will fight to find my own light
I will find the gold and survive
That's commendable, but that's only something that will satisfy you briefly. Remember this...
When you reach the top, it's not over. There are more, and taller peaks to climb. So don't lose yourself in complacency or don't feel like you're done with your life
You'll never be perfect, but you can try to be
That's wonderful. The only path worth following is one lit by your own goals and ambitions
I don't have anything left to teach you. But I want to give you this
The bearer gives you a broken lantern
Bring it with you, it will help you on your journey
$hasLantern = true
Then, in a flash, the mysterious bearer vanishes. Both puzzled and tired, you decide that it's best to go to sleep
Always strive for more
I'm sorry to hear that, why do you think like this?
Having a goal so simple may be effective in the short term, but in the long term you'll start to wish for more. And if you don't recognise that wish, you'll start feeling empty
I'll think about it when, and if, I get there
Then what would be the solution?

It's ok, but remember this: When you finally do something that you wanted to, what happens afterwards? You feel happy for a bit, but then... It just vanishes, and it leaves you feeling... Somewhat worse. That's because life is not like climbing a mountain and trying to reach the top
It's more like climbing many small mountains and seeing how far you can make it before it's over
So don't stop at your immediate needs. Go further
With all that said...
Your fear of death, first and foremost, and then all your other fears
By doing so, you'll learn more and more things about you
You'll see your flaws, and instead of hiding them like many do you'll use them as embers to light a lantern. This lantern will show you the path to follow
Maybe you just need some... first-hand experience
Just remembere to not stop. We are made with two legs to run and catch predators, not to stand still
What's the point of improving if I'm going to die?
It's too hard, for too little of a payoff
Then you can just miserable forever. It's your choice, and I won't force you
Goodbye
Because then you will die without any regrets. If nothing matters, then suffering also doesn't matter
And if suffering doesn't matter, then there's no point in not trying
Yes, maybe I will
No
will you give it a try?
Good... Then, take this
It's okay, that's your choice to make

You were not strong, so you built weapons to defend from predators. You were not finding enough food, so you started to farm and tame animals. You were falling ill often, so you invented medicines to cure your bodies
All of those achievements were made to overcome your limits, but those limits were dictated by one thing... Fear: Fear of being preyed on, of hunger, of illness
So what is the path of humanity, if not that of overcoming fear? And what is the biggest fear, if not that of death?
The thing is, it's only when nobody paves the road for you that you become able to follow the path tha you truly desire
Because you're only thinking short term, and not long term
You keep loking at the "now"
Only because you don't believe in anything now, doesn't mean that you cannot believe in anything ever again. In fact, you'll find that quite the opposite is true
How can I believe in something again
But it doesn't matter if I start believing in something. I will still die someday, and then it will not matter if I had beliefs or not
You'll need to find your own purpouse. If the universe doesn't give you one, find it yourself
You can look at it like that. But doing so, will only bring you misery. I don't have much to discuss with you, if this is all that you'll be able to say
And how do I do that?
Face your fears
Goodbye
Then, in a flash, the mysterious bearer vanishes. Both puzzled and tired, you decide that it's best to go to sleep

The third and final day has arrived. As soon as you wake up, you can clearly see a strange figure staring at you. It's covered in rags, all painted in different colors. The only part of it's body that is not hidden is it's torso, which has a hole inside it from which you can clearly see it's organs. Despite the bizarre and somewhat revolting appearence of this bearer, you don't feel threatened at all
You finally woke up, I was starting to lose patience
Why were you staring at me? You feel like it's normal to do this?
I know why you're here, and I don't want to deal with any of it. Just leave me alone
I sure do... I mean, it's normal for me, at least
The strange figure then exits by jumping out of your cell's window
Ahah, sure, enjoy your last day then
Now that no bearers remain, your punishment approaches
Everybody believes that they are the "normal" ones
Take that weird bearer from yesterday, for example.. He was so pompous, right?
He talked about some abstruse stuff, right?
Yes, but I still understood him
Yes, I didn't understand much
He likes to complicate simple things... Talking about how you're free to find your own purpouse...
And do you agree with him? Don't you still feel like something's missing
No, I know what I must do
Yes, now I'm afraid that if I ever stop I'll lose everything
Because that's exactly what would happen
So the solution would be to never stop...
So what should I do?
You should face reality and confront it
Yes, that's one of the possibilities... But you'll still be living a lie! Nothing matters, and you know it
Living a lie is better than not living at all
So, what should I do?
It doesn't matter if it's a lie
If the world, the universe, and life itself doesn't matter... Don't give up to chaos, just live. Rebel against the order of our universe. Only then will you truly be free
Your mind is already set on it's goals... That's remarkable. But still, I hope that you think a bit more about it. Best of luck, prisoner
If nothing matters or makes sense in this life, your reasoning is worth as much as mine... So it's not worth anything at all
I like how you think... Even if you don't agree with me, I still have a gift for you
$hasBrush = true
This brush... It's not normal. Whatever it paints, it cannot be cancelled
Do you really believe that? And what if there was another possibility?
What's that possibility?
I don't care
Just live

Don't find a meaning. If you do that, every single step, breath and drop of sweat will be filled with life and energy. The world will be your canvas, and you will be the artist. Even if painting will be useless in the long term, it will not matter... Because the act itself will bring you joy
That's an interesting way of thinking
So I should just do what I want? I should kill, maim and steal?
You can do it... But remember that the universe tells you that life has no meaning, so if you destroy it without care you are just following the status quo
I'm glad that you agree. I have something for you
Who know, maybe I am
You're insane
Yeah, I guess
Is that really all you want to be? A pawn?
Or do you want to be free?
Why bother with that, honestly? You know that there's no meaning to life, right?
Yes, I know
But aren't you pissed about that?
No, it's just the way it is
Maybe I am...
Well, that's your choice, I can't argue with that
Well, then that's something
Now, listen to me

The dreaded day has come. You are given a pickaxe and a shovel and are set free outside the safety of your hometown. The gate behind you is locked, and the walls surrounding it are smooth, making climbing impossible.
What will you do?
Approach the mountain and start digging
Look for food and water

As you get closer, you notice a small cave. Inside the cave, a large number of skeletons is laid right at your feet. The sight and the smell almost makes you sick... But the only thing you can do is dig
You start searching for something to eat, and you end up finding a strange tree, with plump and colorful fruits hanging from it's branches. Since you're so hungry, you approach the tree
The walls of the cave are soft, soft enough to be broken with your shovel. After what feels like an eternity, your shovel's handle breaks. It's now completely unusable
Damn, I will have to keep digging with my pickaxe
As you dig, it starts to get really dark. You're now quite deep inside the mountain, and light from the surface struggles to get in.

Suddenly, you hear the ground abouve you rumble. Little pieces of dirt and debris starts falling on your head, then the tunnel crumbles. You're now stuck with barely enough space to move, in complete darkness. You feel like you're suffocating, and your pickaxe is nowhere to be found
Dig with your hands
Give up
You start clawing at the ground with your hands, frantically lifting and launching dirt away. The more you dig, the more your fingers start to hurt.
Keep digging
Give up
As you seem to move an inch in what feels like hours, your fingers start to bleed and your nails break and fall off. You begin to question if the pain is really worth it
Keep digging
Give up

You still keep digging. You are tired, basically at your limit, and your hands are completely messed up. Suddenly, though, you feel an empty space behind the walls of your tunnel. With your last bit of strength you manage to break the soft wall, and end up in a pitch-black cave. With no clear path ahead, what will you do?
I will not surrender now, not after all that I've done
So it was worthless, after all...
Your lantern, which seemed to be broken, lights up. The light inside it illuminates the cave. Now that your path is clear, there's only one thing that you can do: push forward

You keep walking, until you're at a crossroad. You have to choose between left or right, but thanks to the light you notice one thing: The ground in one of the tunnels has collapsed, leaving a deep hole in it's place. Obviously, you take the other way
You find it
The gold exists
$hasLantern = true
So the legend was real... Now, there's only one thing that I can do. Or is there?
Take a nugget and head back
Start painting the gold with the brush
$hasBrush = true
So the legend was real... Now, there's only one thing that I can do. Or is there?
Take a nugget and head back
Ignore it
If they really want the gold, they can have it... But not on their terms

With a painted nugget in hand, you head back to the gate while yelling "I have found it". The soldiers open the gate and look at the nugget, first in amazement and then in shock. Then one of them says:
That gold is worthless now, why did you do it?
I don't know, I just felt like doing it
You ask too many questions... Why, why, it alway has to be why, right?
You worthless scum, you will never get out of here, now
You're insane. We'll just let you rot here

As the guards close the gate, angry and disappointed, they send a last look at you. You greet them with a nice grin, and then start laughing. You may never be pardoned, but in the end, it was worth it. You may be a prisoner, but you're still free
With a nugget in hand, you head back to the gate while yelling "I have found it". The soldiers open the gate and look at the gold:
Wow... So the legend was true... By the law of our town, you're free to go. The lord has truly blessed you
God? It wasn't god that saved my life. It was me

Free to leave and with nowhere to go, you can follow whatever road you want. Nobody can guess what exciting or scary new horizon you will see, but one thing is for certain. Your own lantern will light your path
You lay there, flat on your stomach, and stop struggling. After a while, the tunnel collapses completely, suffocating you
Your journey ends here
You lay there, flat on your stomach, and stop struggling. After a while, the tunnel collapses completely, suffocating you
Your journey ends here
Your journey ends here
You lay there, flat on your stomach, and stop struggling. After a while, the tunnel collapses completely, suffocating you
You begin to walk in the darkness, and slowly you start to get accustomed to it
You sit, and after a while you fall asleep, never to wake up again
After a while, you arrive at a crossroad. Whithout much light, you have to make a decision: Left or right
Left
Right
You die
You keep walking, and then...

You refused to take the gold, and instead came back outside to live on the mountain. While it may be dangerous, you know that those challenges will turn you into something different, something better. After all, you've already confronted some of your fears... And you've survived
Your journey has just begun

With nowhere left to go, you decide to live on the mountain. While it may be dangerous, you know that those challenges will turn you into something different, something better. After all, you've already confronted some of your fears... And you've survived

As you do, you feel something cracking under your feet. What looked like a branch from the tree, starts wrapping around your ankle and thrashing your flesh. The more you move, the more painful it becomes
Don't resist
Use the pickaxe to hit the root
You walk for a while, as you do you start feeling thirsty and tired
Soon, the roots spread around you, wrapping your entire body. The crushing wait strangles you, breaking your neck
Your journey ends here
Rest
Find some water

You lay down, and feel like falling asleep. Your leg is swollen and the wound is oozing some strange, black liquid. You realise that if you fall asleep, you will not wake up. It's strange, though, because even if you know that you're about to die, you don't really care... You don't feel fear, anger, and the pain is fading away. But you still feel something: regret
You find a nice, clean stream of water. You drink, but your thirst doesn't go away. The tiredness grows, so

You lay down, and feel like falling asleep. Your leg is swollen and the wound is oozing some strange, black liquid. You realise that if you fall asleep, you will not wake up. It's strange, though, because even if you know that you're about to die, you don't really care... You don't feel fear, anger, and the pain is fading away. But you still feel something: regret
Am I pretentious? please be honest
Yes
No
Ok
Thank you, It really means a lot to me
Have a good rest of your life, and remember
Then fuck off

Now, all jokes aside, I hope that I still gave you something to think about. Communication is hard, just as hard as life is, but what I wanted to say is... We can all make it. It doesn't matter what we believe in. As long as it allows us to go forward, whatever our goal is, it will be worth it in the end

Communication is hard, just as hard as life is, but what I wanted to say with this story is... We can all make it. It doesn't matter what we believe in. As long as it allows us to go forward, whatever our goal is, it will be worth it in the end
Hello, I have a question for you
Bye :)

_actors._name: The guy who made this shit
